body_html: @mrry You're welcome. While this is certainly a doc issue at this point, I want to raise the concern that assigning tuple and list totally different semantics in Python is very uncommon (even in Tensorflow) and could lead to many suprising moments on user side.
body_text: @mrry You're welcome. While this is certainly a doc issue at this point, I want to raise the concern that assigning tuple and list  totally different semantics in Python is very uncommon (even in Tensorflow) and could lead to many suprising moments on user side.
body: @mrry You're welcome. While this is certainly a doc issue at this point, I want to raise the concern that assigning `tuple` and `list`  totally different semantics in Python is very uncommon (even in Tensorflow) and could lead to many suprising moments on user side.
